@CLEAR_GRAPH.description: The @CLEAR_GRAPH command will delete all the quads in the given graph and return the number of quads that were deleted.

@FORKJOIN.description: The @FORKJOIN command will execute the given commands in parallel.

@HTTP_GET.description: The @HTTP_GET command is used to fetch data from an arbitrary url.

@HTTP_POST.description: The @HTTP_POST command is used to perform an http POST call to an url with a provided body.

@HTTP_PUT.description: The @HTTP_PUT command is used to perform an http PUT call to an url with a provided body.

@IF.description: The @IF command executes then when condition evaluates to true, and optionally executes else when condition evaluates to false.

@LOG.description: The @LOG command executes all the given commands in parallel. The results of these commands will be logged at LogLevel info.

@NEW.description: The @NEW command will create a new subject of the given type in the given graph.

@NEW_GRAPH.description: The @NEW_GRAPH command will create a new graph of the given graphClass type.

@NEW_TRANSIENT_GRAPH.description: The @NEW_TRANSIENT_GRAPH command will create a new transient graph and return the iri of that graph. Any data created in the graph won't be persisted.

@REMOVE.description: The @REMOVE_FROM command removes removal from collection and returns the remaining Collection<T>.
